fields_of_interest: Economy, finance and the euro, Trade, Competition, International co-operation and development, Customs, Energy, Business and Industry, Environment, Taxation, Single market, Research and innovation, Public Health, Transport, Climate Action, Communication
head_office_address: Rua Central Park, Edificio 3, nº 6, 4º C
eu_initiatives: Environment, energy, climate change, sustainability, quality, technology, competition, taxation, health and safety
organisation_name: Associação Técnica da Indústria de Cimento (ATIC)
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
membership: Cembureau, FICEM, CIP, CERTIF, SPES, EMBOPAR, GPBE
goals__remit:
- Its main task is to preserve and strengthen the cement industry competitiveness. 
- Fundamental issues related to environment, energy, climate change, sustainability, quality, technology, competition, taxation, health and safety, are ATIC’s main concerns.   
- Legislative procedures developed within the European Union assume particular importance. 
- Maintains contacts with the European Commission and the European Parliament, as well as with the permanent representation of Portugal to the European Union. 
- Promotes scientific and technical activity on cement and their derivatives in order to improve their quality and their applications. 
- Is the national standards body for cements and concretes by delegation of the Portuguese Standards Body (IPQ) since 1988.
